body_content.explanation: to endow (= give a large amount of money to or provide an income for) a college, hospital, etc. again, for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: After lengthy discussions, the family has agreed to re-endow the university.
The chapel was re-built and re-endowed by Lord Rees.

body_content.explanation: to give a particular quality or feature back to something or someone that had it previously:
examples: How can we re-endow the word with the authority it inspired previously?
